intro: Pavetta bauchei, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators.
